Coming to recipe, today I prepared my lovely evening snack it’s Mirchi Bajji & Cut Mirchi 😋 I love these Bajji’s a lot like to have them when they’re hot, it’s perfect winter treat ❄ I enhanced the taste of Bajji toppings with onion,  Masala powder and lemon juice. I hope you definitely enjoy it Let’s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Long - wide Mirchi / Green Chillies - Chopped ( as shown in picture )
Batter:
  • Bengal gram flour – 520 gms
  • Salt – 1/2 tsp
  • Ajwain / carom seeds – 1/2 tsp
  • Turmeric powder – 1/4 tsp
  • Baking soda – 1/4 tsp
Carom powder for stuffing:
  • Carom seeds - 1 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin powder - 1/2 tb sp
Toppings:
  • Finely chopped white onion - 1/4 cup - 60 gms
  • Red chilly powder - 1 tsp
  • Garam Masala Powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Cilantro - chopped - 1/4 cup
  • Lemon juice - 2 tb sp
Procedure: Batter:
  • In a bowl Add all batter ingredients
  • Mix well
  • Add water little by little and make medium thickness of batter consistency
Stuffing: Carom seeds Powder
  • Add all mentioned ingredients in coffee blender or mixer grinder ( Carom seeds, salt & cumin powder )
  • Blend till smooth powder
Mirchi / Green chillies:
  • Wash chillies twice and clean the excess water with kitchen towel
  • Chop each into half ( Vertically) from top to bottom and again cut them into half ( horizontally)
  • Fill each chilly with carom powder
  • Keep them aside
Process of making Mirchi Bajji:
  • Heat oil to deep fry on medium heat
  • Now all set to make Bajji's
  • Dip each green chilly in batter, make sure it covered completely with batter
  • Slowly drop each chilly in oil ( I added 3 Mirchi Bajji in one batch )
  • Fry both sides till golden brown color
  • Take out them on paper towel.. serve hot
  • Mirchi Bajji ready 😋
Cut Mirchi:
  • Chop the fried Mirchi Bajji into 1/2 inch
  • Again fry them in oil till they turn out crisp and golden color
  • Take out them on paper towel
  • Arrange them in a plate
  • Add toppings and lemon juice
  • Mix well and serve hot 🙂
  • Enjoy Cut Mirchi Bajji and have a good day
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • Instead of red chilly powder you can also use Red Paprika
  • Green chillies I used are zero spice, I chose them to make Bajji. So make sure to use Green chillies aren't spice for Bajji..
